availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, merchant. Nelson County, Kentucky, native. Married to Mary Ellen Hogue Beeler. Father of Lorenzo W. Beeler, Emily P. Beeler, Bettie Beeler, John Beeler, William Beeler, and Jane Beeler Helm. Merchant in Nelson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Nelson County in 1850. Merchant in Marion County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Marion County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District No. 2, p. 345A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District No. 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Lebanon, p. 551.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Lebanon, p. 488A.
Birth and Death Records: Covington, Lexington, Louisville, and Newport (before 1911), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #7007128, Jefferson County Deaths.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #23056.
"Deaths," The Courier-Journal (Louisville, KY), March 19, 1892, p. 7.
